Key Match Events: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game.
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double.
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam for Minnesota in the seventh inning, but it was ruled a two-run double after review.
Wallner's 13th homer of the season tied the game.
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid during a three-run fourth inning for the Twins.
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season among three hits.
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer for Los Angeles.
Rookie starter Jack Kochanowicz allowed four runs in 5 2/3 innings for the Angels.
Minnesota rookie Zebby Matthews started and allowed two runs in just 3 1/3 innings.
Cole Sands pitched 2/3 of an inning in relief.
Jhoan Duran secured his 23rd save despite surrendering three hits in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Matt Wallner expressed that continuous hits and driving guys in scoring position is huge for the team.
Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli commented on the good energy and locked-in performance of the team.
Jordyn Adams reflected on his focus to get the ball in play after fouling back previous pitches.
Jack Kochanowicz mentioned the need to be better with breaking balls and adjusting his pitching strategy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angels' INF Brandon Drury left the game in the fifth inning with left hamstring tightness.
Angels' OF Bryce Teodosio sustained a small finger fracture but is expected to avoid the injured list.
Twins' OF Byron Buxton will be activated from the 10-day injured list prior to Friday's game against Cincinnati.
Twins' Austin Martin will be sent to Triple-A St. Paul in a corresponding move.
Twins' OF Manuel Margot was reinstated from the injured list after missing 10 games with a right groin strain.
Twins' C Christian Vázquez was reinstated from the paternity list.
Twins' C Jaír Camargo and utility player Michael Helman were optioned to Triple-A.
